clinical_study.brief_title: Expanding Rural Access: Distance Delivery of Support Groups (Main Study)
clinical_study.official_title: Expanding Rural Access: Distance Delivery of Support Groups (Main Study)

brief_summary.textblock:
The study will answer two questions about women with breast cancer in rural communities:
1. Will they find this support group format utilizing videoconferencing acceptable and rewarding?
2. Will they report a greater sense of emotional and informational support, and less depression and traumatic stress, than the control groups of women who wait to participate until after the first groups have ended?

primary_outcome.measure: Intensity and frequency of posttraumatic stress symptoms in the past month as assessed by total score on the Posttraumatic Check List - Specific version (PCL-S) for breast cancer.
primary_outcome.time_frame: after 8 weeks of the immediate group sessions

primary_outcome.measure: Intensity and frequency of depression symptoms in the past week as assessed by total score on the Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression scale (CES-D)
primary_outcome.time_frame: after 8 weeks of the immediate group sessions

secondary_outcome.measure: Intensity and frequency of emotional control as assessed by the total score on the Courtauld Emotional Control Scale (CECS),
secondary_outcome.time_frame: after 8 weeks of the immediate group sessions

secondary_outcome.measure: Level of self-efficacy for coping with breast cancer as assessed by the total score on the Cancer Behavior Inventory (CBI).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: after 8 weeks of the immediate group sessions

secondary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction with social support as assessed by the total satisfaction score on the UCLA Social Support Inventory.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: after 8 weeks of the immediate group sessions

clinical_study.condition: Breast Cancer Early Stage Breast Cancer (Stage 1-3)
